User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:6.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0.1
Build ID: 20110830092941

Steps to reproduce:

I had an additional Firefox window open, I removed/hidden Menu, Navigation and Bookmarks toolbars. When I was done with that window, I closed it.
I now have 2 windows remaining - with all the toolbars visible. I then went to the Menu -> File -> Exit.




Actual results:

When I started Firefox, both my windows had no toolbars.


Expected results:

Two of my windows should've had all of the toolbars.

comments.text:
I can reproduce this bug with these steps:
1. Open firefox (1st window)
2. File -> New Window (2nd window)
3. Hide menu bar at the new window (2nd window)
4. Close the new window (2nd window)
5. Close firefox (1st window)
6. Open again firefox, the window has the menu bar hidden but the last closed window (1st one) had not.

I think that the last close window settings should be applied when you open again firefox. 

So, I confirm this bug at Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:9.0a1) Gecko/20110831 Firefox/9.0a1
